summary: The U.S. Marshals Service detains about 60,000 people a day who are awaiting federal trial or sentencing. While it doesn't operate jails, it does partner with public and private detention facilities. The service assesses detention conditions at these facilities. We found shortcomings in its oversight. title: U.S. Marshals Service: Actions Needed to Better Identify and Address Detention Condition Concerns
